Anyway, could you please provide us the information about the Vulnerability Advisory you have received and the version of Netwrix Auditor you are currently in? ( Settings > About Netwrix Auditor), so we can check.

Thank you!

Regards,

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000DA9k6:ref

Hi John,

I appreciate your call back and apologize on my phone issues.  The issue was regarding an email my supervisor received (below).  We have Netwrix Auditor 10.5.10977 and we have CoSoSys Endpoint Protector which is weird because I didn't know Netwrix owns this Endpoint Protector.  The agents for Endpoint Protector are 5.8.4.1 and the server is version 5.7.1.0.  We don't own the server on-prem.  I wanted to know if we need to upgrade from our end with either Netwrix Auditor or Endpoint Protector.


________________________________

From: Netwrix Alerts
Sent: Friday, July 05, 2024 10:06 AM
To: Brandon Benallie
Subject: Important Update to Security Advisory - ADV-2024-002 - Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities in CoSoSys Endpoint Protector and CoSoSys Unify


[https://lp.netwrix.com/rs/130-MAN-089/images/netwrix_logo_141119.png]<https://go.netwrix.com/MTMwLU1BTi0wODkAAAGUWpoSnLpOXTEGx1w564YleVBEzsT3_ZvOToemvA8kuMyYnBgyUTSBf-_zZ4pdoHWTg8iIKbE=>

Security Advisory


On June 27, 2024, Netwrix notified you of the publication of the security advisory ADV-2024-002 - Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities in CoSoSys Endpoint Protector and CoSoSys Unify<https://go.netwrix.com/MTMwLU1BTi0wODkAAAGUWpoSnPrxXTO4E74qDdXxSbx4kvGlktvwTPY50E-2vvnHnoRT1JMrfbgXc04AdqSwPpsqcX4=>, and is notifying you of an important update to this advisory.
A revised hotfix for the CoSoSys Endpoint Protector server has been released and all CoSoSys Endpoint Protector users, including those who applied the original hotfix, are advised to apply this hotfix to their server.
Access to the security advisory requires a Netwrix Customer Portal user account. If you do not already have one, you may register an account<https://go.netwrix.com/MTMwLU1BTi0wODkAAAGUWpoSm7hF3lnE7Tb682YAX3MHmXgqlPznzt7L_vnRkJu3q2r6lX8xe4GxPuHjrdY8K-TjDLQ=> on the Netwrix website.
Should you have questions or require assistance, please contact Netwrix technical support by opening a case in the customer portal<https://go.netwrix.com/MTMwLU1BTi0wODkAAAGUWpoSm2F4D5zadvmX1kLP5GEyUQS3TgOFL78gii7qJSKIcgbQlLv96ERY2Va71iMi2oWR72k=> or by phone at +1 (888) 638-9749. Additional regional phone numbers are listed on the Netwrix technical support<https://go.netwrix.com/MTMwLU1BTi0wODkAAAGUWpoSnLAB4YI9qHii0l4CFxGQhR8tNFCYVkwm5k3YN1vGa5I9euRUfKQE5yJL0Pcd1ZG_0QY=> website.



Thank you for your email.

Sterling R. Morris
IT Security Analyst
Phone: 928-729-8194
Email:  Sterling.Morris@fdihb.org<mailto:Sterling.Morris@fdihb.org>
Fort Defiance Indian Hospital Board, Inc.
www.fdihb.org<http://www.fdihb.org/>  |  Corner of Routes N12 & N7 Ft. Defiance, AZ 86504

Hi John,

 

I appreciate your call back and apologize on my phone issues.  The issue was regarding an email my supervisor received (below).  We have Netwrix Auditor 10.5.10977 and we have CoSoSys Endpoint Protector which is weird because I didn’t know Netwrix owns this Endpoint Protector.  The agents for Endpoint Protector are 5.8.4.1 and the server is version 5.7.1.0.  We don’t own the server on-prem.  I wanted to know if we need to upgrade from our end with either Netwrix Auditor or Endpoint Protector.

 



	
		
			
			 

			
			

			 

			From: Netwrix Alerts

			Sent: Friday, July 05, 2024 10:06 AM

			To: Brandon Benallie

			Subject: Important Update to Security Advisory – ADV-2024-002 – Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities in CoSoSys Endpoint Protector and CoSoSys Unify 
			
		
	



 



	
		
			
			
			
				
					
						
						
						
					
					
						
						Security Advisory 
						
					
				
			
			

			 

			
			
				
					
						
						On June 27, 2024, Netwrix notified you of the publication of the security advisory ADV-2024-002 – Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities in CoSoSys Endpoint Protector and CoSoSys Unify, and is notifying you of an important update to this advisory. 

						A revised hotfix for the CoSoSys Endpoint Protector server has been released and all CoSoSys Endpoint Protector users, including those who applied the original hotfix, are advised to apply this hotfix to their server. 

						Access to the security advisory requires a Netwrix Customer Portal user account. If you do not already have one, you may register an account on the Netwrix website. 

						Should you have questions or require assistance, please contact Netwrix technical support by opening a case in the customer portal or by phone at +1 (888) 638-9749. Additional regional phone numbers are listed on the Netwrix technical support website. 
						
					
				
			
			
			
		
	



 

Thank you for your email.

 


Sterling R. Morris

IT Security Analyst
